name: Acting 3
description: Half of this course will continue and build upon the work begun in first year in Voice, Text, and Movement. The other half will be an Introduction to Scene Study, including character analysis for the actor, with realistic material from the Canadian and International repertoire. The student will be assigned a minimum of 75 hours of production-related duties outside class time over the year; typical tasks are concentrated in 3- to 9-week periods and may include evenings and/or Saturdays. [108P (72 studio classes plus minimum 36 labs and/or production)]
prerequisites: At least 4.0 credits including DRS121H5, 122H5 and DRE/ENG121H5, 122H5
